Grupo Xcaret dedica calaverita literaria: Xcaret Group dedicates literary calaverita to Zacatecas
En el marco de la conmemoración del Día: In the framework of the commemoration of the Day of the Dead, declared Intangible Cultural Heritage of Humanity by UNESCO, Grupo Xcaret launches a series of literary calaveritas created in collaboration with the writer Alejandra Flores, one of them has been dedicated to the state of Zacatecas.
Estas calaveritas, inspiradas en la lite: These calaveritas, inspired by Mexican popular literature, are dedicated to the states that have participated in the Festival of Traditions of Life and Death, an event that, for 17 years, has become a emblematic celebration of the cultural richness of Mexico.
El Festival de Tradiciones de Vida y Mue: The Festival of Traditions of Life and Death in Xcaret is a space for cultural exchange in which different states of the Mexican Republic participate each year, presenting their traditions, music, dance and gastronomy. In this context, Zacatecas had a special role as a guest in 2018, participating with traditional activities such as the Callejoneada Zacatecana, which reflect the historical and cultural legacy of the state.
La creación de estas calaveritas literar: The creation of these literary calaveritas not only celebrates the relationship between Xcaret and the participating states, but is also a tribute to the cultural contributions of each region to the festival. Leticia Aguerrebere, Corporate Director of Art and Culture of Grupo Xcaret, expressed that these literary calaveritas represent our gratitude and respect towards those who, over the years, have shared with us a piece of their traditions and knowledge.
La colaboración con Alejandra Flores, es: The collaboration with Alejandra Flores, a writer dedicated to exalting Mexican roots, reinforces the mission of Grupo Xcaret to disseminate and preserve the Cultural Heritage of the country. The literary calaveritas seek to honor the states that have been part of this celebration, keeping alive the essence of the Day of the Dead and promoting a cultural bridge between generations and communities.
Desde sus inicios, el Festival de Tradic: Since its inception, the Festival of Traditions of Life and Death has served as a showcase to preserve and disseminate the customs of this Mexican festivity, and with this new initiative, Grupo Xcaret reaffirms its commitment as a promoter of the traditions that define the cultural identity of Mexico.
